vibe.label: Defensive Rotation Underway
vibe.desc: Money rotating from growth (-3.7% vs SPY) into defensive sectors (Utilities +9.4%, Staples +7.4% vs SPY). Institutions hedging, not fully exiting equities.

yield_curve.interpretation_text: Steepening — banks earning more on loans vs deposits. Bullish for XLF.

hy_spread.regime_text: HY spreads very tight — investors accepting minimal extra yield for junk risk. Risk-on.

economic_calendar.watch_note: Watch core services, not headline. Shelter costs key.
New orders sub-index is the forward-looking read.
Wage growth (hourly earnings) matters as much as the headline.

economic_calendar.sector_risk: All sectors — primary rate pivot driver
economic_calendar.watch_note: Core services ex-shelter is the Fed's focus metric.
Watch dot plot revision + 'higher for longer' vs 'data dependent' language.

items.headline: This stock is soaring on news of a forthcoming investment by AMD
items.summary: Nutanix, which makes hyperconverged infrastructure including storage offerings, is partnering with AMD and betting that AI customers want flexible ecosystems.
items.one_line: AMD investment news drives single-stock rally; confirms semiconductor demand narrative.

items.headline: Trade Desk’s stock slides as growth slowdown unnerves Wall Street even further
items.summary: The ad-tech provider said automotive and packaged-good clients are under pressure.
items.one_line: Trade Desk misses growth expectations; signals ad-tech sector slowdown amid macro uncertainty.

items.headline: Snowflake’s stock dips as the software company gives a mixed outlook
items.summary: In a market where investors have been quick to punish software stocks, Snowflake’s report didn’t offer enough to excite Wall Street.
items.one_line: Snowflake mixed outlook pressures software stock; clouds AI monetization concerns.

items.headline: Paramount says Warner Bros. acquisition would be an ‘accelerant’ for its turnaround strategy
items.summary: Paramount saw losses rise in its latest quarter, while revenue and streaming subscribers grew in the first full reporting period since its merger with Skydance.
items.one_line: Paramount pitches media consolidation as strategic turnaround; sector M&A narrative active.

items.headline: Salesforce’s stock falls as mixed earnings forecast fails to dispel AI gloom
items.summary: Salesforce announced a $50 billion share buyback and a new AI metric, but investors remain focused on the threat of AI disruption.
items.one_line: Salesforce mixed earnings forecast disappoints; AI enthusiasm fails to support software valuations.

items.headline: Silver tops gold as investors’ go-to hedge against trade tensions
items.summary: Trade escalation can contribute to a slowdown in economic growth and weaken silver demand, but silver’s a “dual-natured metal” that benefits from both investment and industrial uses. That’s a key reason why it has been more of a go-to hedge than gold lately.
items.one_line: Silver outperforming gold as trade-tension hedge; signals rising geopolitical risk appetite.

items.headline: We're boosting our price target on retail stock TJX after another knockout quarter
items.summary: The off-price retailer's annual sales topped $60 billion for the first time.
items.one_line: TJX beats earnings; analyst raises price target, confirming discount retail strength.

items.headline: Steve Madden won’t give profit guidance as planned due to Supreme Court tariff ruling
items.summary: The shoe designer’s stock fell after it held off on providing a profit guidance like it said it would, citing uncertainties created by the Supreme Court’s tariff decision.
items.one_line: Steve Madden withdraws guidance due to Supreme Court tariff ruling; tariff uncertainty heightened.

items.headline: Popular QQQ ETF faces a crucial moment with Nvidia earnings on deck after its rare pullback
items.summary: A popular ETF that tracks the Nasdaq-100 Index has posted a loss over the trailing 50 days — something the fund seldom has done, according to DataTrek Research.
items.one_line: Nvidia earnings catalyze QQQ volatility; key test for mega-cap tech valuations post-pullback.

items.headline: Trump says ‘prices are plummeting’ during SOTU. Here’s what the data say.
items.summary: According to an exclusive YouGov-MarketWatch poll, most Americans say affordability hasn’t gotten better under Trump.
items.one_line: Trump claims price declines; reality check on inflation narrative impacts Fed expectations.

items.headline: Trump says AI will pay its fair share for electricity. Don’t expect cheaper power bills soon.
items.summary: President Donald Trump said during the State of the Union address that tech companies will provide their own power for AI data centers — but energy experts say things are not that simple.
items.one_line: Trump signals AI will subsidize electricity; caps utility cost relief expectations for AI sector.

items.headline: Expect more delayed flights, with TSA workers about to miss paychecks as the partial shutdown drags on
items.summary: Democrats and Republicans are at odds over funding for the Department of Homeland Security, with no resolution in sight.
items.one_line: TSA worker paychecks delayed amid shutdown; operational disruptions pressure travel and consumer spending.

items.headline: Trump digs in his heels on tariffs — with major implications for the U.S. dollar
items.summary: Market strategists were weighing in on President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address late Tuesday and coming away with some important implications for the U.S. dollar.
items.one_line: Trump reinforces tariff stance; major USD weakness and broad market uncertainty ahead.

items.headline: David Tepper sends scathing letter to Whirlpool’s board. Here’s why he’s so upset.
items.summary: “Enough is enough,” the billionaire hedge-fund founder said, accusing Whirlpool of squandering millions of dollars in shareholder value.
items.one_line: David Tepper criticizes Whirlpool board; activist pressure on appliance maker governance.

items.headline: Here’s what CoreWeave needs to prove with its earnings for the stock to soar further
items.summary: The AI-infrastructure darling has seen its stock climb 40% this year. CoreWeave’s fourth-quarter earnings report will determine whether the momentum continues.
items.one_line: CoreWeave earnings crucial for stock momentum; data center infrastructure capex story at inflection.

items.headline: Oracle’s stock selloff offers a chance to buy an ‘upper-echelon’ growth play for cheap: analyst
items.summary: An Oppenheimer analyst has turned bullish on Oracle’s stock after a selloff that has wiped away more than half the company’s value since its September peak.
items.one_line: Oracle selloff creates buying opportunity for growth; analyst supports valuation support narrative.

items.headline: TJ Maxx parent’s earnings show discount clothes and home goods are still in high demand
items.summary: TJ Maxx parent company TJX reported a triple beat with its fourth-quarter results on Wednesday, but shares of the off-price apparel and home-fashions retailer slipped as the outlook disappointed.
items.one_line: TJ Maxx parent earnings confirm discount retail resilience; consumer spending strength sustained.

narratives.verdict_text: **Equity put/call ratio at 1.54** — a level that historically signals retail fear and over-hedging — sits alongside a market that is 6.55% above its 200-day moving average and showing broad participation, with equal-weight stocks (RSP) outpacing the S&P 500 (SPY) by **2.67% over four weeks**. That's the central tension: the options market (where traders buy puts as insurance against a drop) is screaming caution, but price action and rally width are telling a different story. The thing that breaks this standoff is **breadth — specifically, whether the 62.9% of S&P stocks holding above their 50-day moving averages continues to slide**, because that number has already fallen 5.8 percentage points in just ten days, and a break below 55% would signal the defensive rotation hardening into something worse. For now, **high-yield credit spreads at 2.97%** (the gap between risky and safe bonds — tight spreads mean lenders aren't worried about defaults) confirm no stress underneath the surface, so investors should hold existing positions but treat the deteriorating breadth trend as a stop-loss trigger, not background noise.
narratives.vibe_desc: Money is fleeing high-multiple growth stocks (**XLK** down 3.1%, **XLY** down 4.2%) and rotating into defensive sectors that generate steady cash flows regardless of economic conditions (**XLE** up 10.8%, **XLU** up 9.4%, **XLP** up 7.4% over four weeks). This matters because it signals investors are pricing in either slower earnings growth ahead or rising recession risk—they're willing to accept lower returns today in exchange for stability tomorrow. A sharp reversal would require either better-than-expected economic data, a pivot by the Federal Reserve toward rate cuts, or a notable deceleration in bond yields that makes growth stocks attractive again.

sector_why.XLK: Rising rates pressure high-multiple tech valuations severely.
sector_why.XLF: Higher rates boost margins but recession fears dominate.
sector_why.XLV: Defensive appeal amid economic uncertainty supports healthcare demand.
sector_why.XLY: Consumer weakness from higher mortgage rates crimps spending.
sector_why.XLP: Defensive rotation into staples as recession risks rise.
sector_why.XLE: Oil strength and inflation hedge drive energy outperformance.
sector_why.XLU: Yield appeal and defensive rotation attract inflows strongly.
sector_why.XLI: Industrials benefit from stable margins and infrastructure tailwinds.
sector_why.XLB: Commodities strength offsets flow reversal concerns temporarily.
sector_why.XLRE: Rising yields attract income-focused inflows into real estate.
sector_why.XLC: Weak earnings and rate sensitivity offset defensive positioning.
